snippet: State colleges are cutting financing for technical, engineering and health care programs as the need for training in those fields grows.
abstract: Public colleges have raised tuition as state funding has dwindled and are now resorting to even more desperate measures--cutting training for jobs the economy needs most; technical, engineering and health care expertise are among the few skills in huge demand even in today’s lackluster job market; they are also, unfortunately, some of the most expensive subjects to teach.
lead_paragraph: State colleges are cutting financing for technical, engineering and health care programs as the need for training in those fields grows.

headline.seo: State Cutbacks Curb Training in Jobs Critical to Economy
headline.main: Where the Jobs Are, the Training May Not Be
